citeinfo.origin:
U.S. Navy, Office of Naval Research
Carol-Anne Clayson of Purdue University, Department of Earth and Atmospheric Sciences
Lakshmi Kantha of the University of Colorado
citeinfo.title: Studies of the Physical and Biological Processes in the Japan/East Sea using Coupled Numerical Models

abstract.p: The emphasis here is on coupled modeling, using the NCAR MM5 community model in the atmosphere and the University of Colorado modified version of the Princeton Ocean Model (CU-POM) in the ocean. Dr. Clayson's focus will be on the air/ocean coupling while the CU emphasis will be on the bio-physical coupling.

The investigators will adapt the CU-POM presently running in the northern Indian Ocean to the Japan/East Sea. They will then transition this to a fully coupled (with continuous feedback between the atmosphere and ocean) regional model of the sea.

Principal Investigator(s): Carol-Anne Clayson (Purdue) Phone: (765) 496-2866 E-mail: clayson@purdue.edu and Lakshmi Kantha (Univ. of Colorado) Phone: (303) 492-3014 E-mail: kantha@boulder.colorado.edu. International Collaborators: Dr. Moon-Sik Suk (KORDI) and Dr. J.-H. Yoon (RIAM, Kyushu National University, Japan)
Part of the U.S. Office of Naval Research (ONR) supported research in the Japan/East Sea (JES) during 1998-2000. JES website URL: http://sam.ucsd.edu/onr_jes/onr_jes.html

descript.purpose: To utilize regional coupled physical-biological and ocean-atmosphere numerical models of the Japan/East Sea to obtain a better understanding of its circulation, water mass structure, and biological/optical state of its upper layers.

cntaddr.address: Purdue University, Department of Earth and Atmospheric Sciences
